data.title: Obituary for Trevor
data.meta_description: Trevor "Wayne" Thompson, of Hanover, formerly of RR#1 Chesley,  passed away peacefully at The Village Seniors Community in Hanover on Sunday, February 4, 2024. Born on February 19, 1942 to the late Trevor and Evelyn ...
data.text:
Trevor "Wayne" Thompson, of Hanover, formerly of RR#1 Chesley, passed away peacefully at The Village Seniors Community in Hanover on Sunday, February 4, 2024.

Born on February 19, 1942 to the late Trevor and Evelyn Thompson. Farming was Wayne's enjoyment in life, and he was very handy with fixing up just about anything around the farm. He had a great work ethic, which he would go on to pass along to his children as well.

Loved husband of Iradelle of Hanover. Dear father of Dale Lee (Wayne) Eichenberger, Michael (Lori) Thompson and missed by his grandchildren Danielle (Dave), Nicky (Ryan), Brooklyn, Brianna, Brandon (Kayla) and great granddaughter Mekenna. Fondly remembered by his sister Gail Parker, Linda Karn (Len) and in-laws John (Pat) Stewart, and Darylann Thompson (Dan). Special friend to Mike (Kelly) Knapp. Predeceased by his parents, sister Betty, brother Ernie and brothers-in-law Ken Hamel, Ken Karn and Robert Parker.

To honour his wishes, cremation has taken place and a Private Memorial Service and inurnment of ashes will take place in the spring in Hanover Cemetery.

Memorial donations to the Chapman House or to The Village Seniors Community - Residents Fund would be appreciated by the family.

Wayne's family wishes to thank the amazing staff at The Village Seniors Community for all their compassion and comfort - you are very special people. The family also wishes to thank Mighton Funeral Home for all their guidance and support.
